wikipedia_page.main: Jack E. Robinson was a professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1910s. He played at representative level for Great Britain, and at club level for Rochdale Hornets, as a wing, i.e. number 2 or 5. After touring Australasia with Great Britain, Robinson joined the Great War, and was badly wounded at the Battle of Neuve Chapelle in March 1915.

response: *Jack Robinson (footballer, born 1870) (1870–1931), England, Derby County and Southampton football goalkeeper

*Jack Robinson (horse racing), British horse racer of 1905
*Jack Robinson (songwriter) (born 1938), American songwriter and music publisher
*Jack Robinson (anarchist) (died 1983), anarchist activist and editor of the Freedom paper
